title.value: Reference panel guided topological structure annotation of Hi-C data
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper and is repeated in other sections.
title.quote: Reference panel guided topological structure annotation of Hi-C data

extractions.description: This paper introduces RefHiC, an attention-based deep learning framework that utilizes reference Hi-C datasets to improve the annotation of topological structures such as loops and topologically associating domains (TADs) from Hi-C data. By using a reference panel, RefHiC enhances the accuracy and robustness of these annotations across different cell types, species, and sequencing depths.

type.justification: The paper presents the development and empirical evaluation of the RefHiC model, comparing it against other tools using real datasets.
type.quote: We demonstrate that RefHiC enables significant accuracy and robustness gains, across cell types, species, and coverage levels.

name.justification: The research focuses on annotating topological structures from Hi-C genomic data, indicating it belongs to the field of Genomics.
name.quote: Accurately annotating topological structures (e.g., loops and topologically associating domains) from Hi-C data is critical for understanding the role of 3D genome organization in gene regulation.

name.justification: The study is primarily concerned with genomic data and its structural annotations.
name.quote: Accurately annotating topological structures (e.g., loops and topologically associating domains) from Hi-C data is critical for understanding the role of 3D genome organization in gene regulation.

name.justification: The paper introduces a deep learning framework, RefHiC, for genomic data analysis.
name.quote: Here, we present RefHiC, an attention-based deep learning framework that uses a reference panel of Hi-C datasets to facilitate topological structure annotation from a given study sample.

name.justification: The paper introduces and focuses on the development of the RefHiC model for improved topological structure annotation of Hi-C data.
name.quote: Here we introduce RefHiC, a reference panel informed deep learning approach for topological structure (loop and TAD) annotation from Hi-C data.

is_contributed.justification: RefHiC is a novel contribution introduced by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Here we introduce RefHiC, a reference panel informed deep learning approach for topological structure (loop and TAD) annotation from Hi-C data.

is_executed.justification: The model is implemented and tested on real datasets, which implies execution in the research.
is_executed.quote: We compare RefHiC against tools that do not use reference samples and find that RefHiC outperforms other programs.

is_compared.justification: The performance of RefHiC is compared against other TAD and loop annotation tools in the study.
is_compared.quote: We compare RefHiC against tools that do not use reference samples and find that RefHiC outperforms other programs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reference paper not explicitly named but suggested to be the current paper itself due to author overlap and the introduction of the model in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is introduced in the current paper, suggesting no external reference for its original description.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Here we introduce RefHiC, a reference panel informed deep learning approach for topological structure (loop and TAD) annotation from Hi-C data.

name.justification: GM12878 Hi-C dataset is frequently used throughout the paper, as a source data for training and testing RefHiC.
name.quote: We first assessed the loop prediction accuracy of RefHiC on a down-sampled Hi-C data set (500M valid read pairs) for human GM12878 cells.

referenced_paper_title.value: CTCF-mediated human 3D genome architecture reveals chromatin topology for transcription
referenced_paper_title.justification: The GM12878 Hi-C dataset is derived and mentioned as originating from a study on chromatin topology related to CTCF.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The CTCF ChIA-PET data for GM12878 were obtained from ref. 25.

name.justification: The K562 dataset is mentioned as another dataset used for validating RefHiC.
name.quote: We applied RefHiC and other tools (5% FDR) to Hi-C data from human K562, IMR90 , and cohesin-depleted HCT-116, as well as mouse ESC.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cohesin loss eliminates all loop domains
referenced_paper_title.justification: The K562 dataset is referenced from a paper discussing cohesin's effect on loop domains.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The CTCF ChIA-PET for K562 were obtained from ENCODE with accession code ENCFF001THV. The RAD21 ChIA-PET for K562 were downloaded from the GEO repository with accession code GSM1436264.

name.justification: The IMR90 dataset is mentioned as another dataset used for validating RefHiC.
name.quote: We applied RefHiC and other tools (5% FDR) to Hi-C data from human K562, IMR90 , and cohesin-depleted HCT-116, as well as mouse ESC.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cohesin loss eliminates all loop domains
referenced_paper_title.justification: The IMR90 dataset is referenced from a paper discussing cohesin's effect on loop domains.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The CTCF ChIA-PET for IMR-90 were obtained from ENCODE with accession code ENCFF682YFU.

name.justification: HCT-116 is a dataset used to test loop detection robustness under cohesin depletion.
name.quote: Applied RefHiC and other tools (5% FDR) to Hi-C data from human K562, IMR90, and cohesin-depleted HCT-116, as well as mouse ESC.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cohesin loss eliminates all loop domains
referenced_paper_title.justification: The HCT-116 dataset is referenced from a paper discussing cohesin's effect on loop domains.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Applied RefHiC and other tools (5% FDR) to Hi-C data from human K562, IMR90, and cohesin-depleted HCT-116, as well as mouse ESC.

name.justification: The mouse embryonic stem cell (mESC) dataset is used to test the model's cross-species performance.
name.quote: Applied RefHiC and other tools (5% FDR) to Hi-C data from human K562, IMR90, and cohesin-depleted HCT-116, as well as mouse ESC.

referenced_paper_title.value: Multiscale 3D genome rewiring during mouse neural development
referenced_paper_title.justification: The mESC dataset is mentioned as being derived from a study on 3D genome rewiring.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The mESC data were obtained from ENCODE with accession code ENCFF550QMW.

name.justification: The deep learning library PyTorch is used for implementing the neural network models in the study.
name.quote: RefHiC is a Python program available at https://github.com/BlanchetteLab/RefHiC. We implemented the neural network with the PyTorch library.

referenced_paper_title.value: In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (eds Wallach, H. et al.) 32, 8024â€“8035 (Curran Associates, Inc., 2019).
referenced_paper_title.justification: PyTorch is mentioned as being used for model implementation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: RefHiC is a Python program available at https://github.com/BlanchetteLab/RefHiC. We implemented the neural network with the PyTorch library.
